str2: The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Probably from a primary verb eiro; peace; by implication, prosperity.
Anointed One; the Messiah, the Christ. From chrio; Anointed One, i.e. The Messiah, an epithet of Jesus.

parse: Verb - Present Imperative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: (lit: to act as arbiter in the games), I rule, arbitrate. From the same as brabeion; to arbitrate, i.e. to govern.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
Prolonged from a primary kar; the heart, i.e. the thoughts or feelings; also the middle.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Accusative Feminine Singular
Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 2nd Person Plural
str2: (a) I call, summon, invite, (b) I call, name. Akin to the base of keleuo; to 'call'.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
One. (including the neuter Hen); a primary numeral; one.
Body, flesh; the body of the Church. From sozo; the body, used in a very wide application, literally or figuratively.

parse: Verb - Present Imperative Middle or Passive - 2nd Person Plural
str2: A prolongation and middle voice form of a primary verb; to cause to be, i.e. to become, used with great latitude.
Thankful, grateful. From eu and a derivative of charizomai; well favored, i.e. grateful.
